name: v0.12.2
body:
New Features:
- Added `ifdef` and `elseifdef` to allow checking if a name has been declared.
- Allow bitwise operators (`|`, `&`, `&^`, `^`) to be used with boolean operands.

Bug Fixes:
- Indexing `str` with a negative index that is out of bounds now gives a proper error message.

Bug Fixes:
- Fix crash when closure is created inside of a loop.

name: v0.12.0
body:
Breaking Changes:
- `str->replace` now returns a second value: the number of replacements done.
- `echo` can now print out a variable number of expressions.
- destructors for user data now require an extra parameter (the `YASL_State *`).
- Method look-ups now only look at the meta-table, not the object itself.
- Binary operators overloads look in both the left and the right metatables to find the right method.

Improvements:
- Better error messages when a method is not found.

Bug Fixes:
- Fixed dangling pointer in closure upvalues, if closure was deleted before it could be closed.

name: v0.11.12
body:
New Features:
- Allow using `()` for empty returns from functions.
- Allow using YASL functions for iterators.
- Allow using `+` in numeric patterns.
- Add `math.seed` to seed random number generation.
- Add `str->tolist`.

Bug Fixes:
- Fix crash when a function has empty body.
- Fix crash when multiple closures are used.
- Fix `str->split` on longer needle.
- Fix bug with local variables and `continue` in loops.

name: v0.11.11
body:
New Features:
- Allow variadic YASL defined functions.

C API:
- Add `YASL_stringifytop` function.

Bug Fixes:
- Fix error message for `list.spread`.
- Fix collecting empty params into list.
- Fix parsing nested lambdas with a single expression.
- Fix issue with newline insertion inside of multiline comments.

name: v0.11.10
body:
New Features:
- Custom iterators are now allowed in YASL, for looping over any types, not just predefined ones.

name: v0.11.9
body:
New Features:
- Add default for `list.join`.
- Add shorter function syntax for named and anonymous functions.
- Allow user-defined variadic functions in YASL.

name: v0.11.8
body:
New Features:
- Add `error` to allow YASL to cause error explicitly.
- Add `math.clamp` function to restrict values to a range.
- Add `list.remove` for deleting elements from list by value.

Bug Fixes:
- Variadics in nested function calls now expand properly.
- Clean up a few memory leaks.

Internal Changes:
- Clean up tests.

name: v0.11.7
body:
Bug Fixes:
- Fix invalid read in `YASL_tablenext`.
- Fix `tostr` only working with C functions previously.
- Fix error with `tostr` not returning string.

Internal Changes:
- Clean up reference counting implementation.
- Fix more memory leaks in tests.

name: v0.11.6
body:
New Features:
- A `set` may now be constructed from a `list`.

Bug Fixes:
- Fixed a various memory leaks caused by syntax errors.

Internal Changes:
- Change how `echo` is implemented in preparation of variadic `echo`.

name: v0.11.4
body:
New Features:
- Add `list.count` function.
- Allow overloading of `()` syntax with `__call` method.

Bug Fixes:
- Fix forwarding of nested variadic returns.

name: v0.11.3
body:
New Features:
- Update path that YASL checks for C packages.
- Add `list.insert` function.

C API:
- Add `YASL_tablenext` function to iterate over tables.
- Add `YASL_listget` function to index lists.
- Add `YASL_len` function to get the length of the top of the stack.
- Add `YASL_functioncall` to call functions.

name: v0.11.2
body:
New features:
- Add patterns for matching by type.
- Change lookup path for C libraries.
- Change lookup path for YASL libraries.
- Variadic functions in the C API may now have an arbitrary number of fixed arguments at the start as well.

Bug Fixes:
- Foreach loops now correctly exit.
- Fixed handling of empty list in `list.join`.
- Strings with internal NUL bytes are now printed properly.
- Variable declarations with invalid identifiers no longer cause crash.

name: v0.11.1
body:
Internal Changes:
- `yaslapi` now uses `-fPIC`.

name: v0.11.0
body:
Bug Fixes:
- Fix error message for `table.__len`.
- Fix crash when accessing upvalues in wrong order.

New Features:
- Added `list.spread` function.

C API:
- Added `YASLX_checknuserdata`.

Breaking Changes:
- Allow multiple returns in C functions.
- Deleted deprecated `require_c` function (use `__require_c__` instead).
- Deleted deprecated functions from YASLX.
- `YASL_pop` now returns `void`.
- Remove deprecated functions from C API.
- `typename` is now a reserved word.

name: v0.10.3
body:
New Features:
- Functions can now return multiple values

Internal Changes:
- Clean up function call implementation

name: v0.10.2
body:
New Features:
- Allow a guard in pattern matching.
- `__set` now can be overloaded for `list` and `userdata`.

Bug Fixes:
- Various functions mistakenly forgot to set the metatable for new lists/tables they created; this is now fixed.

C API:
- `tostr` no longer forces you to remove items from the stack, to match other methods.
- Deprecate `YASLX_check*` functions in favour of `YASLX_checkn*` functions

name: v0.10.1
body:
Deprecations:
- `require_c` is now deprecated, use `__require_c__` instead.
- `YASL_pushlitszstring`, `YASL_pushlitstring`, `YASL_pushszstring`, `YASL_pushstring` are now deprecated.

New Features:
- Added `__require_c__` as a synonym for `require_c`.

C API:
- Added `YASL_pushzstr`, `YASL_pushlstr`, `YASL_pushlit` for handling strings.

Bug Fixes:
- Fix bug with `list[:]` not having the right metatable.

Internal Changes:
- Clean up methods for `str`, `bool`, `int`, `float`.
- Clean up implementation of names for types (mainly used in error messages).
- Clean up tests.

name: v0.10.0
body:
Breaking Changes:
- C functions now return `void` instead of `int`.
- indexing tables now checks for `__get` first.
- `undef` now equals itself.
- `table` lookups now verify exact type as well as equality.

New Features:
- Indexing can now be used on the left side of multi-assignments.

Bug Fixes:
- Fix error message for `mt.set`.
- Fix bug where reference count wasn't properly incremented in `list.__set`.
- Fix bug where dead-code elimination caused a crash if constants were used in the dead path.
- Fix inconsistencies with `table` lookups involving numeric keys.

Internal Changes:
- Clean up tests.
- Add more tests for `mt` and `io`.
- Add more tests for `match`.
- `int` and `float` values are now interned.
- Improved bytecode for `match`.

name: v0.9.2
body:
Bug Fixes:
- Fix buffer overflow in `table.tostr`.
- Too many `|` in pattern is no longer (erroneously) a syntax error.

New features:
- Allow `()` for grouping in patterns now.

name: v0.9.1
body:
New Features:
- Added `match` statements.

Bug Fixes:
- Fix invalid memory read on stack overflow.
- Fix line numbers in errors in expressions on Clang/TCC.
- `return` outside of function no longer causes crash.

Internal Changes:
- Run unit tests on Windows platforms as well.
- Refactored interpreter tests to use bash.

name: v0.9.0
body:
New Features:
- Added `<`, `<=`, `>`, `>=`, `==`, and `!=` for `collections.set`.
- Added `==` and  `!=` for `list`.
- Added `==` and `!=` for `table`.
- Added `mt.set`.
- Allow newlines after last element of `table` or `list` (previously was syntax error).

Breaking Changes:
- Removed deprecated functions from C API.
- Removed `file` functions from top level of `io`.
- `YASL_pushuserdata` no longer takes a `YASL_Table *` parameter.
- `struct` is now a reserved word.
- `pragma` is now a reserved word.
- `ifdef` and `elseifdef` are now reserved words.
- `<`, `<=`, `>`, `>=`, `==`, and `!=` can now be overloaded for `userdata`, `table`, and `list`.
- Renamed `mt.getmt` to `mt.get`.
- Removed `list.extend`.

Bug Fixes:
- Fix bug with printing to string on MSVC.
- Fix line ending logic on Windows (fixing various parsing bugs).
- Fix float to string conversion for `inf`, `-inf`, and `nan` values.

Internal Changes:
- Run tests on MSVC now.
- Run tests on MinGW now.

name: v0.8.4
body:
New Features:
- Allow omitting the start or end in slices, which defaults to the start or end of the collection.
- Added `io.file.close` and `io.file.seek`.
- Added multi declarations/assignments for variables.
- Added `collections.set.__get`.

Bug Fixes:
- Fix segfault when parsing malformed indexing.
- Fix segfault during stack overflow.

Internal Changes:
- Cleaned up opcodes.
- Strings literals are now interned.

name: v0.8.3
body:
New Features:
- Stack traces for runtime errors, detailing where each function was called from.

Bug Fixes:
- Fixed line numbers for some runtime errors.
- For loops inside functions containing local variables now work properly.

Internal Changes:
- Variables at the top level of a file are now stored on the stack, to clean up implementation.

name: v0.8.2
body:
New Features:
- Added `assert`.
- Added `__VERSION__`.
- Added `args`.
- Added line numbers for runtime errors.

C API:
- renamed functions in `yasl_aux.h` to use `YASLX_` prefix, and deprecate old versions.
- renamed functions using `integer` and `boolean` to use `int ` and `bool`, and deprecated old versions.

Bug Fixes:
- Fixed bug where a missing final semi-colon/newline didn't cause an error, but printed an error message.
- Fixed memory leak when `YASL_newstate` is called with an invalid file name.
- Allow `YASL_delstate` to be passed `NULL` (it does nothing in this case).
- Fixed bug when indexing lists out of bounds.
- Fixed bug when indexing strings out of bounds.

Internal Changes:
- Cleaned up error messages in parser.
- Cleaned up runtime errors.

name: v0.8.1
body:
New Features:
- Added anonymous functions.
- Added `require_c`, to allow loading of modules written in C dynamically.

API Changes:
- Cleaned up the naming of the API, and deprecated old versions.

REPL Changes:
- `quit` is now a builtin function instead of hardcoded.
- REPL now prints large "YASL" on startup.

Bug Fixes:
- Fixed error messages for  `collections` library.
- Fixed error messages for `math` library.
- Fixed error messages for the `io` library.
- Fixed bug where `collections.set` could have non-hashable items added.
- Fixed bug where `collections.set.add` could add non-hashable items.
- Fixed bug where `collections.table` could have non-hashable keys added.
- `%=` now works.

Internal Changes:
- Added proper error checking for `math` library.
- Added  proper error checking for `collections` library.
- Added proper error checkign for the `io` library.
- Added more tests for C API.
- Added tests for augmented assignment.
- Removed unneeded allocation in `echo`.
- Clean up implementation of BIFs to take advantage of changes to C API.

name: v0.8.0
body:
New Features:
- added closures.

Breaking Changes:
- change set difference to use `&^`.
- `assert` is now a keyword.

Bug Fixes:
- Disallow mutable keys in `table`.
- Proper error message when trying to set a key that is out of bounds in a `list`.

C API:
- remove all deprecated functions.
- deprecate `YASL_getstringlen`.

Internal Changes:
- Increased MSVC Warning levels.

name: v0.7.3
body:
New Features:
- `str.replace` now takes an optional parameter, the max number of occurrences to replace.
- added `set.tolist`.

C API:
- added `YASL_pushlist`.

name: v0.7.2
body:
Internal Changes:
- Now compiles with TCC.
- Improved bytecode generation for if statements.

name: v0.7.1
body:
C API:
- added `YASL_top_popcstring`.

Internal Changes:
- renamed all opcodes to start with `O_`.
- added `O_ICONST_B1` opcode for encoding small integers in one byte.

name: v0.7.0
body:
Breaking Changes:
- remove all deprecated functions from C API.
- `match` is now a reserved word.
- `global` is now a reserved word.
- `header` is now a reserved word.

API Changes:
- added `YASL_pop` to eventually replace `YASL_popobject`.

Deprecations:
- deprecate `YASL_UserData_gettag`.
- deprecate `YASL_UserData_getdata`.
- deprecate `YASL_pushobject`.
- deprecate `YASL_Function`.
- deprecate `YASL_CFunction`.
- deprecate `YASL_Table`.
- deprecate `YASL_UserData`.

name: v0.6.6
body:
New Features:
- C API now has functions to deal with user-pointers and user-data under new API.

Deprecations:
- Deprecated most functions that use `YASL_Object`.

Bug Fixes:
- Fixed one of the error messages for malformed interpolated strings.
- YASL_(String) functions used to incorrectly return NULL.

Internal Changes:
- cleaned up lexer implementation.
- cleaned up parser implementation.

name: v0.6.5
body:
API Changes:
- add functions to check type of top of stack.
- add functions to peek value of top of stack.
- add function to load a global variable onto the stack.

Bug Fixes:
- removed `list.slice` function. (Should have been removed a long time ago.)

Internal Changes:
- add tests for C API
- deprecate most functions in C API relying explicitly on `YASL_Object`.
- cleaned up test implementation and added more tests.
- YASL can now pipe stdout and stderr to strings or alternate files (useful for mocking tests).

name: v0.6.4
body:
Bug Fixes:
- Fix buffer overflow in `list.tostr`.

name: v0.6.3
body:
New Features:
- Changed `char *` to `const char *` in `yasl.h`.
- Added `YASL_isuserpointer`, `YASL_getstring`, `YASL_getuserpointer`, `YASL_getfloat`, `YASL_getboolean`, `YASL_getinteger`.
- Added `YASL_resetstate`, to reset the state using a file.

Bug Fixes:
- using `undef` as a key in a table no longer causes double free.

Internal Changes:
- now compiles on MinGW (with Azure Pipelines to test this).
- cleaned up parser implementation.

name: v0.6.2
body:
New Features:
- added `collections.list` and `collections.table`, in order to construct lists and table from a function if needed.
- allow declarations of the form `let a, let b, let c = x, y, z`.

C API:
- Added `YASL_pushlitstring`, `YASL_pushszstring`, `YASL_pushlitszstring`.
- Including `yasl.h` now requires including less other files.
- Added `YASL_settable`.
- Deprecate `YASL_Table_set`, `YASL_Integer`, `YASL_Undef`, `YASL_Float`, `YASL_Boolean`, `YASL_LiteralString`, `YASL_CString`, and `YASL_UserPointer`.
- Added `YASL_DEPRECATE`, for deprecating things.
- Added comments for all functions in `yasl.h`.

Bug Fixes:
- interpolated strings no longer get stuck in an infinite loop in errors.

Internal Changes:
- change `Lexer` and `Parser` to `struct Lexer` and `struct Parser`.
- change `YASL_HashTable` to `YASL_Table`.
- clean up data structures.

name: v0.6.1
body:
New Features:
- `set.collections` now takes a variable number of arguments (instead of always `0`).
- added `math.max` and `math.min`.
- added `int.tobool`.
- added `float.tobool`.

Bug Fixes:
- built-in functions now return proper errors.

Internal Changes:
- Allow C API functions to have variable numbers of arguments.
- Clean up data-structures.
- Clean up includes in interpreter.
- Tests for a variety of type errors.

name: v0.6.0
body:
Breaking Changes:
- `io.read` now defaults to reading a line.
- removed `str.slice` and `list.slice`.

New Features:
- add `set.contains`.

Internal Changes:
- print number of tests ran.
- move all data-structures to a new folder and rename them.
- remove old out of date examples

name: v0.5.5
body:
Bugfixes:
- fixed memory leak in `table.copy`
- fixed memory leak and invalid write in `table.tostr`

Internal Changes:
- moved more tests to C from Perl.

name: v0.5.4
body:
Bug Fixes:
- fixed bug where extending list caused segfault with size 0 list on left.
- fixed bug where `list.tostr` of nested lists leaked memory.
- fixed bug where `list.copy` wrote to invalid memory.

Internal Changes:
- Added tests for lists and strings.
- Reorganized tests

name: v0.5.3
body:
New Features:
- added default value for `str.trim`, `str.ltrim`, `str.rtrim`.
- added default value for `str.split`.
- added `table.remove`.

Bug Fixes:
- Fixed bug where `trim` would segfault if not used with string literals.
- Fixed bug where nested strings in interpolated strings wouldn't parse properly.

Internal Changes:
- MSVC warnings are now fatal.
- MSVC now compiles with no warnings.

name: v0.5.2
body:
New Features:
- added `collections.set`
- added `set.__bxor` (symmetric difference)
- added `set.__band`(intersection)
- added `set.__bor` (union)
- added `set.__sub` (difference)
- added `set.add` 
- added `set.remove`
- added `set.clear`
- added `set.copy`
- added `set.__len` (cardinality)
- added `io.stdout`
- added `io.stdin`
- added `io.stderr`
- added line by line read option to `io.read`
- allow `io` functions to be called as methods from a file object.
- allow overloading `len` operator via `__len` method.

name: v0.5.1
body:
Internal Changes:
- improved constant folding.
- improved print implementation

Bug Fixes:
- printing functions is no longer a segfault.
- bumped version number
- fixed error message for `pure` keyword
- fixed bugs with modules (where global state wasn't preserved).

name: v0.5.0
body:
Breaking Changes:
- now use `let` for declarations instead of `:=`.
- modules now use `export` statement.
- added `pure`, `consteval`, `constexpr`, `constfold`, `extern` as keywords.

New Features:
- `fn f.m ...` style declarations

Bug fixes:
- `str.tofloat` now parses exactly the same things as float literals.

Testing:
- added automated tests for C/C++ Clang on MacOS, C++ GCC/Clang on Linux, C MSVC on Windows.

name: v0.4.3
body:
New features:
- added hex escapes in strings
- added `io.write`
- added `io.flush`
- unlimited globals now allowed
- added `require` function.

Bug Fixes:
- fixed memory leak when turning table to string.

Internal Changes:
- compiles as C++ now
- clean up for emscripten
- improved const correctness
- more tests

name: v0.4.2
body:
New Features:
- Added exponential notation for floats.

CLI:
- Added `-C` option (check syntax only)
- Added `-e` option (execute statement and print)
- Added `-E` option (execute statement)

Bug Fixes:
- Fixed bug caused by too many function params.
- Fixed bug caused by too many local variables in functions.
- Fixed bug where `a[b] += c` didn't work in some cases.
- Fixed bug where `a[b]` didn't work for strings.

Internal Changes:
- added more tests
- added some stuff to make emscripten happier

name: v0.4.1
body:
New Features:
- added `s[a:b]` notation for slicing lists and strings.

Improvements:
- Expression statements are eliminated if they are literals or variables.

Bug Fixes:
- Fix bug where strings inside functions in certain cases were double freed.
- Fix bug where REPL would crash after 1 correct input, 2 incorrect, and 1 correct.

Internal Changes:
- Better debugging info for internal debugging.

name: v0.4.0
body:
Breaking Changes:
- rename `str.repeat` to `str.rep`.
- moved `nan` and `inf` to standard math lib.
- parsing floats from strings now tries to parse int and coerce if parsing float fails.

New Features:
- added operator overloading for arithmetic and bitwise operators.
- add `+` for list concat.

name: v0.3.7
body:
Bug Fixes:
- Fixed bug where double hashing failed in some cases (which caused compiles to take up to 5 minutes for small scripts).
- Too many variables in a given scope now raises an error instead of breaking. (current limit per scope is 256.)
- Fixed segfault that happened when parsing and a keyword showed up unexpectedly in some cases.
- Fixed segfault in REPL when calling user defined functions.

Internal Changes:
- Added tests for certain "failing" behaviours such as division by 0, type errors, assigning to constant, etc.

name: v0.3.6
body:
New Features:
- Added REPL
- Added `bool.tobool` (does nothing)

Internal changes:
- Runtime errors now are returned as exitcode

Bug Fixes:
- Division by zero and modulo zero is a proper error now instead of crashing YASL.

name: v0.3.5
body:
New Features:
- added `math.inf`
- added `math.nan`
- allow underscores in numeric literals now

Bug Fixes:
- `!` followed by id starting with `in` are now parsed properly.
- segfault no happens during syntax errors (previously certain ones caused a segfault).

Internal Changes:
- removed submodules (everything now in main repo)
- flattened structures
- removed probalistic primality testing.
- slight changes to allow easier compiling on windows

name: v0.3.4
body:
Added Features:
- `list.sort` method added
- add `math` library
- `str.count` method added

Bug Fixes:
- fixed bug where `??` operator returned first `undef` instead of first thing that's _not_ `undef`.

name: v0.3.3
body:
New Features: None

Bug fixes:
- using method calls no longer evaluates the expression twice.
- fixed memory leak in `table.clear`.
- fixed bug where nested function calls crash
- fixed memory leak with parsing floating point literals

Implementation changes:
- more constant folding (for all numeric types + bool now).
- improved test suite.

name: v0.3.2
body:
New Features:
- const functions
- const function parameters

Internal Changes:
- constant folding on all integers operators.
- shorter opcodes for some ints
- shorter opcodes for some strings
- improved hash function for strings

name: v0.3.1
body:
New Features:
- `list.tostr` and `table.tostr` now show contents.
- added `list.clear` and `table.clear`.
- added `list.join`.

name: v0.3.0
body:
Breaking changes:
- declare variables with `x := 12` now.
- declare constants with `const x := 12` now.

New Features:
- string concat and string interpolation now coerce to string.
- added string `repeat` method.
- added list `slice` method.
- strings are now iterable.

name: v0.2.2
body:
Internal Changes:
- code cleanup

New Features:
- Variables can now be declared with `x := 10` syntax.
- Constants can now be declared with `const x := 10` syntax.

Breaking Changes:
- Changed `int64` to `int` and `float64` to `float`.

name: v0.2.1
body:
New Features:
- Added interpolated strings.
- Added more string escapes to help with interpolated strings.
- Allow `.x` (treated as a string literal). 
- Allow members named after keywords to be accessed using `m.for` syntax.
- Improved error messages.

Bug Fixes:
- cleaned some memory leaks.
- fixed bug preventing recursive functions.

Internal:
- Cleaned up code and updated style guide.
- Added many more tests.

name: v0.2.0
body:
Breaking Changes:
- Single quoted strings now support escapes.

Bug Fixes:
- Clean error message when .ysl file is not found.

New features:
- Lexical comparisons of strings using <, <=, >, >=.
- Added CLI options: -V to display version, -h for help.
- Raw strings using backticks.
- Added basic IO functionality: opening files and reading from files.

Internal Changes:
- Clean up code to conform to style guide.

name: v0.1.0
body: First stable release of YASL.
